title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer tells Manchester United players they are going to get him sacked
text:
United put in another dismal performance against Newcastle (Picture: Rex Features)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer branded his players ’embarrassing’ and spectacularly declared they were going to get him the sack after their loss to Newcastle, according to reports.

The defeat to Newcastle has increased the pressure on Solskjaer, who now fears his job hangs in the balance.

Solskjaer has repeatedly slammed his players behind closed doors this season, but has always opted to defend his squad in public.

The Sun claim the Norwegian is now becoming more and more alarmed about his position at United and told his players they were going to get him fired.

Solskjaer insisted the display against the Magpies was ’embarrassing’, with United now stranded in the bottom half of the Premier League table.

Advertisement

Advertisement

United are just two points above the relegation zone and Solskjaer ripped into his under-performing players following the Newcastle game.

Solskjaer insisted it was not just him that faced the axe, but the players were likely to be ousted by the manager who took over following his dismissal.

The Norwegian told his players to have a hard look at themselves during the international break.

United welcome Liverpool to Old Trafford after the international break (Picture: Getty)

United will be back in the deep end once the break is over later this month, with Liverpool scheduled to visit Old Trafford.

Ed Woodward has already given his backing to his under-fire coach, but there are growing fears inside the club a heavy defeat to Liverpool will spell the end of Solskjaer’s time in charge.
